scenarios.question: The responsibility to ensure the valid credentials of the UPT Sigma Tandem Examiner before the course begins, belongs to whom?
Have you verified that your UPT Tandem Examiner’s rating is current for the duration of the course?
Have you read the Sigma Manual in its entirety?
Do you have a current and approved medical?
Normal drogue fall terminal velocity is?
Tandem freefall terminal velocity is?
How many seconds does it take to fall 1,000 feet at terminal velocity with a drogue?
How many seconds does it take to fall 1,000 feet at terminal velocity without a drogue?
What is the main purpose of a drogue?
If a drogue is deployed after 20 seconds of tandem freefall, how long will it take to slow the tandem down to 120 mph?
A packed Sigma tandem system and student harness weighs approximately?
A packed Micro Sigma tandem system and student harness weighs approximately?
What is the minimum exit weight of the Sigma Tandem System?

choices.B: 200 lbs. (90.7 kg) for VR 360 / SR 370 / SR 340

scenarios.question: What is the maximum combined suspended weight for the Sigma system? For the Micro Sigma Tandem system? (Specify both reserves)
How do you calculate your maximum tandem student weight?

choices.A: Maximum system weight minus tandem instructor weight minus sigma system weight
choices.B: Maximum system weight minus exit weight
choices.C: Sigma system weight minus student harness weight minus tandem instructor weight
choices.D: Maximum system weight minus sigma system & student harness weight minus tandem instructor weight

scenarios.question: How long should the trap door effect be?
What problem is caused by a drogue center line that is too short?

choices.B: Slower than normal tandem terminal speed
choices.C: Longer than normal trap door effect

scenarios.question: What problem is caused by a drogue center line that is too long?

choices.A: Drogue will not extract the bag
choices.C: Slower than normal drogue fall speed

scenarios.question: How can you tell if a drogue was cocked during packing?

choices.A: It was packed by a rigger
choices.B: If the safety pin is seated correctly
choices.C: Bridle scrunched and drogue centerline window color
choices.D: If the closing loop is properly routed

scenarios.question: What might happen if you deploy a drogue which had not been cocked properly during packing?

choices.B: Will not create enough drag to pull safety pin
choices.C: Terminal velocity increases. Drogue should inflate within 6-8 seconds
choices.D: It will not deploy the main

scenarios.question: What would happen if you held onto the drogue during drogue deployment?

choices.B: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: What is the purpose of the “safety pin” on the drogue bridle?

choices.A: To ensure the drogue is cocked
choices.C: Ensures the main container opens before the drogue collapses
choices.D: Helps prevent the main container from opening prematurely

scenarios.question: What length should the exposed kill line be above the grommet at the base of the drogue envelope during drogue calibration?
How often should the drogue calibration be checked?
What would happen if the kill line were not attached to the #5 link at the top of the main deployment bag or the kill line were to break during deployment?
What are the negative consequences of such an occurrence (question # 25)?

choices.B: Open container with drogue issues malfunction

scenarios.question: Explain the negative consequences of loose student side attachment straps on exit?

choices.A: Rocking drogue fall, student’s legs outside instructors

scenarios.question: What is the main reason to avoid reaching in front of a student?

choices.A: This is the appropriate response to put the student into the proper position
choices.B: The student might grab your arms

scenarios.question: What should you feel immediately upon pulling the drogue release handle?

choices.D: Separation from the main canopy risers

scenarios.question: Which direction should the closing pin be inserted?

choices.B: In the direction of the arrow on the disk
choices.C: From the bottom of the container

scenarios.question: What might happen if the closing pin is inserted from or pointing in the wrong direction?

choices.A: It could cause a Partial Malfunction
choices.B: It could cause a Total Malfunction
choices.C: It could cause a Horseshoe Malfunction
choices.D: It could cause an Open Container with Drogue Issues Malfunction

scenarios.question: What will happen to the pull force if you pack twists into the ripcords below the pin?

choices.B: Cause a collapsed drogue in tow

scenarios.question: What AAD unit manufacturers are authorized for the Sigma Tandem System? (In the approved tandem configuration or mode)
The red lanyard attached to the Sigma RSL is connected to the…
The Collins Lanyard is designed to do what?

choices.C: To act as a secondary cutaway device
choices.D: Release non-RSL riser if the right riser releases prematurely

scenarios.question: What does the 17 Point Check represent?

choices.A: On aircraft checks for the instructor and student

scenarios.question: What is the minimum functionally open main parachute altitude for tandem jumps after probation?
What is the minimum exit altitude for tandem jumps after probation?
What are the leading causes for a tandem pair going unstable when leaving the aircraft?

choices.B: Poor presentation into the relative wind
choices.C: Improper set up, launch, fly away

scenarios.question: Where can you find the regulations on who may do RW with a tandem pair?
Where do you find the requirements for videographer qualifications before they can film a tandem?
When should the drogue be deployed during a stable, uneventful tandem exit?

choices.A: Within 3 seconds of leaving the aircraft

scenarios.question: Is backing out of a side door aircraft on tandem jumps allowed?
What is the minimum horizontal separation under canopy for a tandem from any other canopy?
The responsibility for pre-flighting a UPT Tandem system belongs to?
The responsibility for ensuring that a Sigma tandem system have in-date reserve repacks and are Product Service Bulletin compliant falls on whom?
What is the proper student arm position on exit?

choices.A: Thumbs under the main lift web, arms crossed
choices.B: Thumbs under the main lift web, arms uncrossed
choices.D: Arms in a neutral box position

scenarios.question: What is the minimum briefing you should give any student before a tandem jump?

choices.A: Briefing on how to exit and freefall
choices.B: Briefing items under FAR Part 105.45 OR in accordance with governing body’s tandem briefing requirements

scenarios.question: What is a negative aspect of over training a tandem student?
What is the minimum age for tandem jumping on a UPT Sigma within the United States?
Which administrative actions does Uninsured United Parachute Technologies, LLC require before a passenger / student does a tandem jump?

choices.D: USPA or UPT Assumption of Risk Waiver Video

scenarios.question: How many tandem jumps in the last 12 months must a rated instructor make to renew a tandem rating?
If a Tandem Instructor (after probation) has not made a tandem jump between 90-180 days, they must:

choices.A: Review SOPs and 2 jumps with an evaluator
choices.B: Review SOPs and 1 jump with an experienced jumper
choices.C: Review SOPs and 2 jumps under the supervision of an examiner
choices.D: Review SOPs and 2 jumps with an experienced jumper

scenarios.question: If a Tandem Instructor (after probation) has not made a tandem jump between 181 days – 2 years, they must:

choices.A: Review SOPs, EPs and 2 jumps with an evaluator
choices.B: Review SOPs, EPs and 1 jump with an experienced jumper
choices.C: Review SOPs, EPs, 1 solo jump and 1 tandem jump with an experience jumper under the supervision of an examiner
choices.D: Review SOPs, EPs and 2 jumps with an experienced jumper

scenarios.question: What additional training must a student be given if they have access to the drogue release?

choices.A: Be given an altimeter and trained how to use it, 3 PRCPs with full gear on
choices.B: Where the pull handle is and how to use it
choices.D: That they must pull 6 inches and then release

scenarios.question: Under what circumstances is relative work (docking) not permitted?

choices.B: When the student has access to the drogue release and has been trained how to use it
choices.C: It is always permitted as long as the videographer only docks onto the passenger
choices.D: It is always permitted as long as the videographer only docks onto the instructor

scenarios.question: What is the minimum number of tandem jumps that need to be made before using a handcam on tandem jumps?
Are pole camera mounts authorized for use on handcam tandem jumps?
What is the maximum degree of turn for tandem canopies at or below 500ft (150m) AGL?

choices.C: Whatever is necessary for a safe landing

scenarios.question: Are Handles Checks REQUIRED on EVERY TANDEM SKYDIVE regardless of whether the tandem instructor is using a handcam device on the tandem jump?
When are you to start your handles check?

choices.B: At some point before drogue release
choices.C: After you set drogue and check drogue

scenarios.question: What is the correct procedure for handles check in order of execution:

choices.B: Left drogue release, secondary, cutaway, reserve, crystal ball
choices.C: The order is not important as long as you touch all the handles
choices.D: Left drogue release, right drogue release, cutaway, reserve, RSL, altitude

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure below 1,500ft (500m).

choices.A: If aircraft is stable, stay with the aircraft and follow directions from the pilot. Ensure the student is seated and seat belted
choices.B: If aircraft has catastrophic damage, attach as many attachment points as the situation will allow, starting with the upper left hook. Hold the student with right arm and legs if needed, exit and immediately deploy the reserve
choices.C: Assure the student that everything is going to be okay

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure between 1,500ft (500m) and 4000ft (1200m).

choices.A: Attach the student, exit the aircraft and immediately deploy the reserve
choices.B: Assure to the student that everything is going to be okay
choices.C: Stay in the aircraft and land with the airplane

scenarios.question: Describe the correct aircraft emergency procedure above 4000ft (1200m).

choices.A: Stay in the aircraft and land with the airplane
choices.C: Attach the student, exit, deploy the drogue, ensure inflation then release drogue

scenarios.question: Describe the correct cutaway procedure for a partial malfunction.

choices.B: Remove RSL, cutaway, ensure separation, deploy reserve
choices.C: Strip the right, track and pull reserve

scenarios.question: What is the correct procedure for a premature deployment of your main (horseshoe) in which you cannot deploy the drogue?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: Which is the correct response to an inflated drogue (“in tow”) that does not release the main pin during a main canopy deployment attempt?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: What is the correct response to an uninflated drogue right after drogue set?

choices.A: Wait 6-8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it does not, pull drogue release
choices.B: Wait 6-8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it does not, Total Malfunction EP
choices.C: Wait 6-8 seconds for drogue to inflate, if it does not, Partial Malfunction EP
choices.D: Dip a shoulder to get clean air into your burble

scenarios.question: What is the correct response to a collapsed drogue in tow?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: What should you do if you accidentally pull the drogue release handle before you deploy the drogue?
What should you do if you can’t extract the drogue from its pouch after your second attempt within 10 seconds after exit?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: What should you do if the bridle wraps around you or your passenger and you can’t clear it?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: What is the correct response if the drogue does not release after pulling left drogue release, right drogue release, and both together? Conduct…

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: Explain the correct way to pull your reserve or cutaway handles free of their Velcro pockets.

choices.A: Peel upward and outward, then pull downward

scenarios.question: What would you do if your left shoulder was dislocated, and you needed to pull your reserve?

choices.A: Pull the reserve handle using your right hand
choices.B: Ask the student to pull the reserve handle for you
choices.C: Nothing, the AAD will activate at 2000ft (600m)
choices.D: Disconnect RSL and pull upwards using the RSL Lanyard to deploy the reserve

scenarios.question: What is the primary cause of tandem incidents that result in a fatality?
What is the procedure for a videographer caught in your drogue bridle?

choices.C: Open Container with Drogue Issues EP

scenarios.question: In an entanglement scenario where both jumpers have no good canopy and are below 3000ft (900m), what should the entangled parachutists do?

choices.B: The lower jumper initiates cutaway to increase separation
choices.C: The higher jumper initiates cutaway first, followed by the lower jumper
choices.D: Both jumpers disconnect RSLs and attempt to climb above the other

scenarios.question: What is the proper instructor action in a high wind landing with no ground assistance available?

choices.A: Keep toggles in both hands and run with the canopy
choices.B: Collapse the canopy by releasing one toggle and pulling the other hand-over-hand. If unsuccessful, disconnect RSL and cutaway
choices.C: Immediately pull the cutaway handle while airborne
choices.D: Disconnect the RSL and PLF with toggles in hand

scenarios.question: What can be done, after opening the main canopy, to make the student’s harness more comfortable?

choices.C: Have the student sit back in the harness

scenarios.question: The Side Lateral Connections must be detached, loosened, and reattached where?

choices.D: There is no need to reattach anywhere

scenarios.question: What is your decision altitude?
What is your ‘do not cutaway below’ altitude?
